Reviews.Title: “theft?”
Reviews.Author: Biggi0
Reviews.Content: Plusses: situated right in the center, within walking distance to many sights (Prado, Opera, Plazas), room spotless, good beds, friendly and familiar atmosphere. Breakfast ok for 3 euros. Great chance to practise your Spanish since hostal personnel hardly able to speak decent English. Minusses: loud environment, so impossible to sleep with window open; strong smell of chlorex in the room. Considerable fly in the ointment: new Camper shoes, bought on the Calle Arenal on Monday, Oct 31 for 160 euros and kept in a shop paper bag by the bed, disappeared from the room! Nobody knows "whodunnit", so when adding this loss to the room price, the room price stopped being a bargain - although the shocked receptionist offered not to charge for breakfast. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chetraveller
Reviews.Content: Hostal Riesco was so cute, clean, friendly and excellently located. I will recommend this place to my friends and other travellers. It is located right on Puerta del Sol, two steps from the metro and yet on the corner of a quiter street. My room was bright, spacious and with an excellent wide compfortable bed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: readytoretirecalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our trip and were quite pleased with it. And it's great value for the money. I found the people on the front desk very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious - our bathroom was quite small, but adequate. Everyone seemed to be aware that they needed to be considerate of others and we found no noise from the other guests at all. They offer a breakfast for a moderate price, but we didn't opt for it - we chose to go out and forage for our breakfast. But they very kindly kept some milk that we had bought in their fridge, since one of our group is celiac and brought his own breakfast cereal. Can't beat the location - 15 steps from the Plaza del Sol!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hostel, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Skultvate
Reviews.Content: Even at booking online, a big red message explained we had to be quiet. Little did we know how quiet. Yes we travelled on a lads' holiday. Yes there was a group of 10 of us. However, no we didn't spend any more time than absolutely required in the hostel and no, we didn't make any mire noise than snoring or quiet conversations while there. Despite this every interaction with the staff from check in to check out was accompanied by a sneering sense of superiority which made you feel far from comfortable. Maybe they aren't used to larger groups or maybe they just want older couples to stay but as a Hostal in the centre of Madrid maybe they should widen their target markets. The accommodation was fine, the service was diabolical and could have ruined the experience. Stay here if you're over 50 and want to be in bed by 11 each night. If not, don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value! Spotless, charming and in the center of town.”
Reviews.Author: courtneyflying
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Riesco for a long weekend getaway. It was perfect! In the center of town, right next to the Puerta del Sol, conveniently close to all of the downtown sights, restaurants, bars and the metro. We booked our room for 55Euros a night, and were so happy with our choice! The hotel is in an interesting old building and has many charming rooms, some facing the plaza with juliet balconies. Our room was upstairs in the back, so a little quieter. There were all hardwood floors throughout, and it was freshly painted and immaculately clean. The bed in the room was a small double bed, a little tight for two, but was comfortable. Some rooms had larger beds. The bathroom is also tiny, but clean and functional. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative is that you have to ring to be let into the building. This makes it very safe, but we felt quite bad ringing to be let in after a night out at a club. However, we were very promptly let in by the night desk worker (but clearly we woke her up. sorry!) The hotel offers breakfast, which you order the night before. It was good for the price. There are coffee shops and restaurants nearby that have wider selections. The hotel also offers Wi-Fi in the lobby, and had a lending library.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo62
Reviews.Content: Hostal Riesco is similar to a nice pensione in Italy. Located on two floors of an old building on the Puerta del Sol square it is perfectly located in the center of Old Madrid. It is right across the street from one of the hub metro stations. From this metro, you can get everywhere quickly. Of course, you are a short walk from the Prado, Cava Baja nightlife, the Huertas nightlife, Plaza Mayor and other destinations. There are many little shops right outside the front door including a very nice bakery. The bedroom and the bathroom were very spacious. The decor and furniture are very simple, but functional. The place was clean as a whistle. This was a tremendous value at 56 euros for a double room. The staff was very helpful if you had questions. A few items of note, the TV has no english channels and the upper floor does not have wireless access. You have to go downstairs to the sitting area or breakfast area to use the wireless internet. The connection was fine when sitting downstairs. It is not too noisy, but if you are very sensitive to noise ask for an inside room.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this place, excellent value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: klisa77
Reviews.Content: Heard about this place from a friend. Was delighted when we got there, prime location, excellent value for money, spotless, comfortable with a great view. Wasn't expecting much because of the cheap price so was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Amazing view in the heart of peurto de la sol. 2 second walk to the metro, which is so easy to use. Was staying with a friend and we each had a lovely comfortable double bed. Place had character and was very clean. Its not the four seasons but it definitly did the job and surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lied about air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: DubaiProfessor
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, they told us the room had air conditioning, but then they hardly turned it on. And Madrid was really hot in the afternoon! We tried to get them to turn it on at night at least, but they refused. "It's impossible," the man said. So with the windows open, it was extremely noisy and we didn't get a good night's rest. What a shame, as it has the perfect location. But there are hundreds of hostals in the area - so I recommend that everyone give Hostal Rieso a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: binzzz
Reviews.Content: simply perfect basic place, sympa people and super location. Just go!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Danyellow
Reviews.Content: From our window we were able to watch a Semana Santa procession, and see the touristy Plaza del Sol. The Sol metro station was very close and convenient. The people who worked at this hostal were very pleasant and friendly. Some quirks: There is an annoying band that often plays loudly in Plaza del Sol, you must check in your hotel key every time you leave your room, and our shower was held together with duct tape (but worked fine).

Reviews.Title: “Good place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Iamsterdam11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights earlier this March. We were very active in the city and for 55 Euros/night this place was great. Right on Puerta del Sol it is very convenient to the metro. We never had a problem with the noise. It was easy to find and there are a ton of good bars/restaurants nearby. It is within walking distance of many of Madrid's main attractions. Overall we enjoyed Hostal Riesco. Our room was very simple and the bathroom was small. There was no hairdryer (in case you need one) and the water pressure seemed fine. If you are active in the city and are just looking for a place to come back to, sleep, and keep your things this is a solid option.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Living_Overseas
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Hostal Riesco and have two young children. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the room was of adequate size. I would have preferred a real bathroom door vs. an accordian door. The heat worked well and there was hot water and good shower pressure. There was also wifi available in the breakfast area, but not in our room. Breakfast was coffee, juice, toast and a croissant. The location on Plaza del Sol cannot be beat. We had terrible weather the week we were in Madrid, but it didn't matter as we could dash to the metro quickly. There are many good restaurants in the surrounding area. We would definitely stay here again and the people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. When we had a problem with our room they were very accomodating in changing us to another room. I would list the ONLY downfall was smoking. The folks at the front desk smoked, as well as guests, and even the bath towels had a faint smell of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ailton-Brasil
Reviews.Content: We stayied there for the New Year. Woderful location and excellent management. Good price. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location, definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: friendlucy
Reviews.Content: We really have nothing bad to say about this place! The location could not be better. We had an en-suite room with a balcony overlooking Sol (room 135)- great for people watching and atmosphere. Sol metro is steps away although we were so central we ended up walking everywhere and only ever needed to take the metro to get to the airport! The windows were fairly soundproof so when closed it really was not very loud but we were there in October and happy to sleep with them closed- it could have been quite loud with them open on this side of the hotel. I also loved that we had a proper double bed (not two singles pushed together) and wi-fi is included. The hotel staff were very friendly and the place was always clean. The rooms are basic and fairly small but 50 Euros for an en-suite, clean, central double room with friendly and helpful hotel staff- what more could you ask for for the price?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Location, Price...”
Reviews.Author: swamper70
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times, and enjoyed the "Family" atmosphere and meeting other people over the space of time. Service is excellent and the rooms are attended to daily, without fail. We have relatives that live in Madrid and when we can visit them, we stay here, since they are familiar with the owner. At times, it does get noise from the street, but that can happen even at a more expensive place. The management even allows temporary storage of baggage, when your plans calls for a 1 to 2 days overnight stays in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Small; but awesome and great location”
Reviews.Author: karichiqi
Reviews.Content: First, the hostal is located in a small side road of Plaza Mayor. So GREAT Location! Across the street from a Metro station, so even better! It made it very central and great. Only downside, is since there is no AC, one would like to leave the windows open to cool the room at night, but it can get pretty noisy from the streets. The hostal is at the third floor, with lots of uneven steps; but its ok really :). There is a small elevator- but don't expect to fit more than 2 people in there. Service was great. Cleaned the rooms daily. You have to leave the key at the desk anytime you leave the rooms. Someone is always at the desk. Bathroom is really tiny; but its okay. Beds were very big and spacious; but pillows were attached to bed and a little hard. Free wifi was available- just have to ask for the WEP password at the front desk. Overall, great location, GREAT VALUE if you are planning to just sleep here really.

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills acomodation”
Reviews.Author: K806
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hostel Riesco for three nights whilst visiting my sister who lived in Madrid. The rooms were very clean and quite spacious, the staff were friendly and helpful. The bathrooms could be a little bit bigger but overall well worth the price and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location”
Reviews.Author: bluedaisy
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms. Ask for a room away from the street, to be on the safe side with the noise factor. Right on Plaza Sol, with a subway stop. Small laundromat with internet access is within walking distance, but know the word for laundromat in spanish to ask directions (front desk doesn't know and I forgot it already.) Hostal has more rooms than expected. It's not romantic or anything, just a convienent, clean, well-run place. We were even able to leave our bags there for a week when we went to Morocco. Walking distance to the Botin, the oldest restaurant in the world. Surprisingly great food and cheaper than expected.
